Your Resource to Make Great Coffee at Home

Make a tasty pour-over at home!

Discover a whole new palate of flavors

Suggested Coffee Equipment:

  • Grinder
  • Scales
  • Kettles
  • Drippers

Instructions:

  1. Heat your water to around 90-96°C
  2. Grind your coffee beans to a medium consistency
  3. Rinse your filter with hot water
  4. Add the grounds to the filter
  5. Slowly pour hot water over the coffee grounds in a circular motion
  6. Allow a "bloom" period at the beginning
  7. Continue to pour steadily until the desired amount of coffee is brewed
  8. Use a scale to precisely measure your coffee grounds and water for consistent results

Key Steps:

  • Prepare your equipment: Choose a pour over coffee maker, filter, and a gooseneck kettle for precise pouring.
  • Grind your coffee: Grind fresh beans to a medium-fine consistency, similar to table salt.
  • Heat water: Heat your water to between 90-96°C (depending on your coffee bean roast).
  • Rinse the filter: Pour hot water through the filter to remove paper taste and warm up the brewer.
  • Add coffee grounds: Place your measured coffee grounds in the filter.
  • Bloom the coffee: Pour a small amount of water to saturate the grounds, allowing them to "bloom" for a few seconds.
  • Pour water steadily: Slowly pour water over the grounds in a circular motion, starting from the center and moving outwards.
  • Monitor extraction time: Adjust your pour speed to achieve your desired extraction time.
  • Enjoy: Once brewed, carefully pour the coffee into your cup.

Important Considerations:

  • Grind size: A finer grind will result in a stronger coffee, while a coarser grind will be weaker.
  • Water temperature: Adjust the water temperature depending on your coffee bean roast.
  • Pouring technique: Practice a consistent pouring motion to ensure even extraction.
  • Scale usage: Using a scale to measure your coffee grounds and water will lead to more consistent results.
